phrases.text: Có bao giờ tôi thấy như vậy đâu à
phrases.english: Have I ever seen such a thing before?

culturalContext.description: Opening rhetorical question expressing surprise or disbelief
facts: Rhetorical questions are common openings in Vietnamese folk songs
À is a questioning particle adding emphasis and seeking confirmation
Structure sets up narrative of unexpected discovery
culturalContext.musicalContext: Opening question establishes emotional tone of surprise and confusion

phrases.text: Có ai ngờ bố mẹ cô đã dối người
phrases.english: Who would have thought her parents had deceived people

culturalContext.description: Revelation that parents have deceived the community about their daughter
facts: Family honor and public reputation are central concerns in Vietnamese culture
Deception about a daughter's whereabouts suggests marriage arrangements
Folk songs often address community gossip and social expectations
culturalContext.musicalContext: Statement of central conflict - parental deception revealed

phrases.text: Nói cô đã đi suối mà sao thấy mời
phrases.english: They said she went to the stream, but why do I see invitations

culturalContext.description: First lie exposed: claimed she went to the stream, but invitations being sent
facts: Going to the stream (đi suối) is common excuse for women's absence
Mời (invitations) suggests formal event - likely wedding preparation
Contrast between mundane errand and formal event reveals deception
culturalContext.musicalContext: Evidence of deception begins to accumulate - invitations contradict story

phrases.text: Những người anh em đã về đây
phrases.english: Siblings and relatives have already arrived here

culturalContext.description: Family members gathering - clear sign of wedding ceremony
facts: Anh em refers to extended family network in Vietnamese kinship system
Family gathering is prerequisite for major life events, especially weddings
Narrator observes contradictory evidence accumulating
culturalContext.musicalContext: Evidence mounts - family arrival confirms suspicions

phrases.text: Có ai ngờ bố mẹ cô đã dối người
phrases.english: Who would have thought her parents had deceived people

culturalContext.description: Refrain repeats central accusation - parental deception
facts: Repetition emphasizes shock and moral judgment
Refrain structure common in folk songs for emphasis and memorability
Community voice expressing collective disapproval
culturalContext.musicalContext: Refrain reinforces central theme before presenting more evidence

phrases.text: Nói cô lấy củi trong rừng
phrases.english: They said she went to gather firewood in the forest

culturalContext.description: Second lie: claimed she went to gather firewood
facts: Gathering firewood is traditional women's work in rural Vietnam
Like going to stream, it's believable excuse for extended absence
Series of lies shows elaborate attempt to hide wedding preparations
culturalContext.musicalContext: Second excuse revealed - parallel structure with first lie

phrases.text: Sao tôi thấy mời những người thông gia
phrases.english: Why do I see invitations to the in-law families

culturalContext.description: Undeniable proof: invitations to thông gia (in-law families)
facts: Thông gia refers to relationship between two families joined by marriage
Inviting thông gia is definitive proof of wedding ceremony
This revelation leaves no doubt about the deception
culturalContext.musicalContext: Climax of evidence - in-law invitations are undeniable proof

phrases.text: Hai họ khắp nơi kéo về
phrases.english: Both clans from everywhere are streaming in

culturalContext.description: Two families converging from all directions for wedding ceremony
facts: Hai họ (two clans) emphasizes union of two family lineages
Kéo về (streaming in) suggests large-scale family gathering
Wedding involves entire extended family networks from both sides
culturalContext.musicalContext: Visual imagery of families converging creates climactic moment

phrases.english: What do you say now, miss?

culturalContext.description: Direct confrontation - demanding explanation from the young woman
facts: Title phrase asking the woman to account for the deception
Abrupt ending leaves question hanging, inviting answer or defense
Folk song structure often ends with unresolved question for dramatic effect
culturalContext.musicalContext: Closing question directly addresses the subject, demanding response
